member.name: kernel32.dll
member.summary: Removes the specified value from the specified registry key and subkey.

param.name: hKey
param.para: A handle to an open registry key. The key must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, seeRegistry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle is returned by the or function, or it can be one of the followingpredefined keys:

member.param: The name of the registry key. This key must be a subkey of the key identified by the hKey parameter.
The registry value to be removed from the key.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS.
If the function fails, the return value is a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to get a generic description of the error.
